West Bank: After nine months of Israeli military operations, refugee camps are 'uninhabitable'
subhead: The destruction of buildings, water pipes and the electrical system by the Israeli army has made it impossible for the 30,000 forcibly displaced Palestinians to return to normal daily life.

US health agency website updated to reflect Trump administration's vaccine skepticism
subhead: Despite years of research demonstrating no causal link between vaccinations and autism, the website now rebukes the scientific evidence.

title: Yeb Sano, a Filipino activist attending his 22nd UN Climate Change Conference: 'Despite the challenges, we cannot afford to lose hope'
subhead: At COP19 in 2013, Yeb Sano, then the lead negotiator for the Philippines, moved the world with an emotional speech. Now at COP30 in Brazil, he continues his fight for climate justice.

title: Frida Kahlo self-portrait sells for $54.66 million
subhead: The sale of the painting by the legendary Mexican artist set a new record for the price of a painting by a woman.

title: Azzedine Alaïa's Dior collection on view in Paris
subhead: The Galerie Dior is showcasing around one hundred pieces from the personal collection of French-Tunisian designer Azzedine Alaïa, a renowned fashion collector. This rare and captivating exhibition is richly documented and unprecedented in scope.

COP30 overshadowed by trade tensions: 'How to collaborate on decarbonization while protecting economic interests'
subhead: The issue of international trade has taken on unprecedented importance in the global climate negotiations currently underway in Brazil. Disagreements center on the European carbon border adjustment mechanism.

title: 'The Nuremberg trials mark a seminal moment that put an end to the impunity of heads of state'
subhead: On November 20, 1945, in the southern German city of Nuremberg, a historic trial began for around 20 top Nazi officials. Historian Sylvie Lindeperg recalls how the event became a major milestone for international justice.

title: War in Ukraine: Russians and Americans negotiate again behind Europe's back
subhead: As Volodymyr Zelensky faces a corruption scandal within his inner circle, the White House and the Kremlin have presented him with a plan that heavily favors Russian demands regarding ending the war and ensuring the continent's security.
